We believe in the democratization of the capital markets. All enterprises should have access to capital to build great companies, develop groundbreaking technologies, and build world-class teams of talent. Likewise, all investors should have opportunities to participate in the performance of startup companies. However, we also believe in the need for thoughtful and effective tools to regulate such an ambitious and burgeoning capital marketplace. Crowdfunding portals are at the forefront of this process. Our goal is to enable crowdfunding portals to focus on their core competency of building great user experiences and innovative tools for helping investors find and evaluate investment opportunities. We provide transactional, compliance and fiduciary services to crowdfunding portals that will allow them to orchestrate and close crowdfunding transactions in compliance with the JOBS Act, all while maintaining an undisrupted user experience. We are driven to improve scalability and efficiency for portals under the JOBS Act's challenging regulatory regime. To do so, we partner with market leading technology providers focused on the specific challenges of the crowdfunding environment.

We urge all stakeholders in crowdfunding to adopt responsible and robust attitudes towards the compliance and transactional aspects of crowdfunding to protect the vitality of, and investor confidence in, this capital marketplace.

intro: Why choose Zen Digital? It is a simple holistic approach to website analysis and reporting. The intention with every client to level up their organization. It starts with listening to the client's goals for their business and asking where they are stuck. Having that knowledge and then analyzing their data and enables me to give them an objective plan of action to move their organizations forward. How did Neil get to the digital space?  It was by accident. Spending numerous years in the financial services sector being an analyst, after my last position ended, it was a simple decision never to go back to that industry. By accident, I was hired from a phone interview for an analyst role at a local travel company. Within three months, the digital world landed in my cubicle. It was a self-study in Web Trends, Omniture - Adobe Analytics, and Google Analytics. In my time there, the digital space was still young, and mobile was in its infancy. The group managed a multi-million dollar business unit direct to consumer online travel brand. It was the most profitable business unit in the company. The corporate world can be cruel, and someone came up with a better idea. The business unit was eliminated. From there, I spent a short period in the healthy and beauty product sector. Equiti is doing something revolutionary―creating the first open, universal secondary market for the global digital gaming community. Equiti is a curated blockchain-based gaming platform that enables the purchase, distribution, and exchange of digital games. We empower consumers by allowing them to sell, rent, lend and gift these digital media assets, while providing game developers and publishers the freedom to determine how their digital media is used.

Digital technology has transformed the global video games industry, but the move from physical to digital media has restricted the rights of users to resell, lend, rent, or give away the games they purchase. The current digital gaming market also places serious constraints on game developers and publishers, narrowing their distribution options and increasing their costs while reducing sales longevity and limiting overall game exposure. Using blockchain, Equiti enables secure transactions, ensures authentic ownership of digital goods, and gives consumers, developers and publishers more choice and control over their game assets.

contact_address: 68 Jay Street, Brooklyn, NY, 11201, US
intro:
Secure, private conversation for everyone.

We believe everyone needs to have a private conversation online once in a while. And everyone is entitled to have one. We are making Tunnel X the best place to have this conversation. The best experience, the best security, and privacy, too.

With the explosion of social networking over the past decade, most of the new ideas have focused on public, group communication (Facebook, Twitter, et al.). There has been remarkably little innovation focused on private conversation. Tunnel X addresses just that: it is a Web-based platform for secure, one-to-one communication. Two people use the service to converse in writing, as they might using email or instant messaging. Tunnel X improves on the conventions of both in important ways. The system is very secure, storing messages in an encrypted format which can only be decrypted when one of the correspondents is online. Tunnel X comes without the visual and functional overhead of email, and as a separate service, is not compromised by exposure on your screen at home or work. In an increasingly public, exposed digital world, Tunnel X offers an essential alternative: a private space for conversation, shielded from the prying eyes of competitors, governments, marketers, or nosy colleagues or roommates.

intro:
Purchase handmade products from artisans directly in the developing world.

Mission
We want to connect you directly to small businesses in the developing world. No more middle men: we want you to be able to buy handmade goods from the artisans who produce them

Description
How it all works:
We have coordinated with artisans in the developing world to manage an online shop: they created their storefronts, posted their products, and uploaded their stories. They did this all in their native language and then the website auto-translated the text for you to view. In fact, you can even message them and we will auto-translate that too.

When you purchase a product, we send the artisan a text message reminder to ship your order. Once they receive the text, they go to a local internet cafe to print the order info from our website. With the info in hand, they package your order for delivery and then drop it off at a local post office. In a short period of time, your products are on your doorstep.

It goes to show just how technologically interconnected we really are.

Teams need to pass through weekly checkpoints and are guided by mentors throughout the process. Winning projects will receive grants to support continued development.

contact_address: New Lab, Brooklyn, NY, 11205, US
intro:
The Consensus Driven Map of the World

At FOAM, we are committed to building spatial protocols, standards and applications that bring geospatial data to blockchains and can empower a consensus-driven map of the world. FOAM has three main components:
1) Crypto-Spatial Coordinate - An open-source standard for embedding physical location in Ethereum smart contracts.
2) The Spatial Index & Visualizer (SIV) - A visual blockchain explorer for creating, viewing, and interacting with Crypto-Spatial Coordinates on a web map. The SIV can serve as the front-end for decentralized applications and will facilitate FOAM's token curated registries for geographic points of interest.
3) Proof of Location - A protocol for decentralized networks to come to consensus on the location of objects and entities in space and time. It is broken into two categories: static and dynamic. Static proof of location allows FOAM Cartographers to apply token curated registries to geographic points of interest (POIs) to generate trusted and reliable POI data. Dynamic proof of location utilizes a decentralized and permissionless network of radio beacons to determine if and when a particular entity was at a certain location. It is done in a privacy-preserving manner and utilizes a Byzantine fault tolerant protocol to prevent fraud.

intro:
A freelancer or freelance worker is a term commonly used for a person who is self-employed and is not necessarily committed to a particular employer long-term. Freelance workers are sometimes represented by a company or a temporary agency that resells freelance labor to clients; others work independently or use professional associations or websites to get work.

While the term "independent contractor"? would be used in a higher register of English to designate the tax and employment classes of this type of worker, the term freelancing is most common in culture and creative industries and this term specifically motions to participation therein.

Fields, professions, and industries where freelancing is predominant include: music, writing, acting, computer programming, web design, translating and illustrating, film and video production, and other forms of piece work which some cultural theorists consider as central to the cognitive-cultural economy.

contact_address: Brooklyn, NY, 11211, US
intro:
We're on a mission to foster balance, healing and human wellness.

As Einstein said once, “No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.”
 
In the last few decades we’ve seen tremendous growth in technology, medicine, and industry. However despite these advances, human beings on the planet face a range of multidimensional crises that threaten us as a whole. Depression, anxiety and suicide rates point to a significant crisis that is affecting people of every color, class, and creed. While science and technology have given us information, content, and access to incredible goods & services, we are failing as a society to address the psychological, emotional, financial, and sociological needs of people. We stand at a crossroad.
?
As founders, entrepreneurs, and investors who struggled with our own mental health, we realized that people’s mental health & wellness needs are highly underserved and are at the focal point of the crisis. While the industry grows, many lack access to the tools and resources to feel balanced and fulfilled in their journey. Hence we launched Heal Ventures to accelerate humanity’s collective growth and evolution, by changing the narrative of mental health & wellness, to be one of stigma and reactive treatments to open, proactive, and celebrated.

Similar to our perspective on mental health & wellness, we take a holistic approach to company building. We emphasize using validation and learning to understand market demand, risk and opportunities. By first understanding consumers’ and businesses’ needs, demands and diverse perspective, we gain a greater understanding that informs the product and solutions we bring to market. We both explore ideas internally and partner with founders and changemakers to bring their visions to life.

intro:
Like all good ideas, HeyMama started as a solution to a problem. Founders Amri Kibbler and Katya Libin set out to create what was missing in their own lives: a community of career-driven mothers who have each others’ backs and actively seek to improve their lives while also lifting up those around them. It seemed so obvious that something like this should exist, so they built it. In the years since, the HeyMama team and community of members has grown like wild ― turns out, this is a need a lot of women have been missing.

And our shared hunger for a community to pour our energy into makes sense. As professionally ambitious women, the odds are against our continued achievement after having kids. A stark lack of systemic support and resources affects working mothers across all industries, both a product of the stigma against working moms and fuel for its continuation. The relationships we build ― and the networks through which we build them ― are the invaluable basis of all the ways we thrive and succeed. The fact that our kids are watching how we work and how we conduct our lives adds even more pressure ― we want to model a healthier, more vibrant and balanced working life and community for our kids as much as we want it for ourselves.

Helping moms find each other and connect in meaningful ways is a complicated task ― and it’s exactly what HeyMama does.

As diverse as our goals and lives are, HeyMama members have one thing in common: We have incredibly high expectations for our careers and personal lives ― and no single one of us knows everything we need to know to make it all work. HeyMama is an ecosystem built for members to come together for the collective benefit and advancement of the whole community, in our work, our families, and ourselves.

contact_address: 14 Wall St, Huntington, New York, 11743, US
intro: Howl is a community safety app connecting neighbors through localized channels and content to make them safer, stronger, more engaged, better informed, and more productive in their communities. While other online communities are overrun with spam, trolling, negativity, fake accounts, political rants, and other distractions that aren’t constructive for the local community, Howl cuts through the digital noise of other social channels to connect users with local, relevant, and urgent information. LOCAL: On Howl’s interactive map-based platform, neighbors share and engage with localized content in close proximity to them or their home. Local topics tend to get lost in excessively large “neighborhood” forums. For that reason, Howl connects its users exclusively with neighbors living on the same street via their “Street Channel.” Users have the option to include an exact location in their group posts, and will appear on group members’ maps better than any neighborhood watch. RELEVANT: For those that want to engage with their community beyond their Street, Howl also connects users to their Street and Town channels. As seen on other platforms, these much larger groups have the potential to foray into polarizing topics that have nothing to do with community. Instead of allowing algorithms to dictate what is important to a community, Howl gives its users the power to vote. URGENT: Not all relevant content is created equal. Some messages are extremely time sensitive and carry more weight than others, and for that reason, Howl enables its users to create and share real-time “Urgent” posts. Aside from this, The Howl Voice Alert integrates with Alexa, Siri, and Google Home, to instantaneously connect users to their Pack (family, friends, trusted neighbors) in the event of an emergency.

contact_address: Fort Greene, Brooklyn, New York, 11217, US
intro:
LOVELINK, the science of love and sex: a practical guide and resource to navigating modern love by two Brooklyn therapists sharing knowledge, science, and attempting to tackle the questions on relationships and sex in all forms.
 
People no longer live within the neatly drawn lines of “single”, “taken”, “gay”, “straight”, or even “male” or “female” as done in generations before. More than ever, identity markers once thought to be integral to an individual’s sense of self have been shucked in favor of the belief that people are never “one size fits all”: fluidity in all its forms is the name of the game and finally, there’s place where people can access literature that pertains to them, is written in their language, and from their perspective. Signe Simon and Simone Humphrey, both working therapists, met while training at the Brooklyn Veteran’s Association and immediately connected over the shared view that there exists a massive hole in online stratosphere where people can access scientifically based, all-encompassing, and, most importantly, compelling content from young mental health professional’s pertaining to love, relationships, and sex. LOVELINK facilitates a new and unique experience for the young person navigating the often-nebulous waters of love and sex. Through advice columns, links to relevant work from other professionals, information on workshops, and podcasts prepared by the founders, LOVELINK offers a truly modern experience for the person longing for literature that not only reflects their sensibility and world-view, but also challenges them.

intro:
Lucky Local enables brand marketers and merchants to connect with the growing number of consumers who combine the ease of Internet product research with the conveniences of local shopping. Driven by such factors as the need to get the product immediately, see the product before purchasing and avoid shipping costs, 70% of consumers engage in “cross-channel” shopping C online research, offline buying. It is estimated that online and Web-influenced offline sales combined accounted for 42 percent of total retail sales in 2009 and by 2014 that percentage will grow to 53 percent, when the Web will be influencing $1.4 billion worth of in-store sales.

Lucky Local clears a path between search and purchase by offering the power to reserve products for immediate in-store pick-up. While shoppers enjoy the option of buying their researched-for items at nearby locations, merchants and brands benefit with in-store traffic and deeper consumer traction.

The LuckyLocal.com product search and pricing comparison website currently includes 45 big box stores offering 2.6 million products. With the addition of its newly developed application program interface (API) and web widget products to its online and mobile offerings, the company provides its network of merchants and affiliates the ability to cater to more consumers who demand hyper-local content and services.

intro:
When buying a car, the typical shopper only usually considers two factors: price and product features. However, a lot of information remains unknown. Were the production materials ethically sourced? Did the car manufacturer contribute to your local political election to avoid taxes? Is the firm investing in green technology, or actively fighting against it? Are there policies in place to encourage diversity in employment or women on the board?

Because of the sheer number of purchases we make each day, it is impossible for the average person to remain informed across all relevant social and political metrics of the companies he or she does business with. These information asymmetries prevent us from shifting our purchase behavior to competitors whose products may be slightly more expensive at face value but are much more aligned with our personal values, making up for the price or quality difference. Together, we can overcome these issues, and make the marketplace a force for change. MarketVote is currently under development. For consumers, our toolset will empower proactive, value-based research, as well as promote innovative news-based market reactions. For businesses, our unique platform is the only source for information on how issues are percieved by your customers. Know their values or risk losing their business to a competitor who is doing more. Interested in joining the MarketVote movement? Message us today!

intro:
At stickK, we’re passionate about behavior change. Founded on the principles of behavioral economics, our goal-setting framework allows users to create Commitment Contracts to leverage incentives and accountability in changing their behavior.

stickK launched in 2008  with a consumer facing website that is free to use. You start by defining your goal―anything from losing 15 pounds or running a marathon to saving money, watching less TV, or completing first draft of masters thesis. From there, you set the stakes. Studies show that people are up to three times more likely to achieve a goal if their own money is on the line, so as part of your Commitment Contract, we encourage you to put your money where your mouth is--agreeing to forfeit a set amount if you don’t succeed at your goal. Next, designate a trusted friend or family member to verify your progress report as your Referee. Lastly, invite your friends to follow your Commitment and cheer you along as Supporters, who’ll receive weekly updates on your progress.

By creating a Commitment Contract, you put your goal in writing, set a timeline, and give yourself additional incentives to achieve it.

stickK users have signed more than 465,000 Commitment Contracts and put over $42 million dollars at stake through our consumer-facing website. In 2010, stickK launched a private label version of our public platform for organizations to use to encourage behavior change with their constituents. These programs are each customized to the specific needs of our clients and come in all shapes and sizes. Large employers use stickK to run employee wellness programs and offer rewards for success and engagement. Hospitals and healthcare providers provide programs for patients, and businesses offer programs to their consumers to increase brand awareness. Because Commitment Contracts help people achieve any type of goal, the possible applications are limitless. For more information: http://enterprise.stickk.com/

contact_address: Brooklyn, New York, 11206, US
intro:
### About Us:

At Wami, we create high-quality, personalized, handwritten note campaigns at scale. We specialize in working with the world's top luxury retail and eCommerce companies to create moments of surprise and delight.

Like our customers, our craftsmanship and attention to detail are unsurpassed. These values are why we serve more luxury brands than any vendor in the industry.

### Why we exist:

Today's marketers face all sorts of challenges in creating successful customer retention programs and nurturing brand loyalty.

We believe there are better ways to connect with customers than email. With handwritten notes, you can bring your message out from their digital screens and into their hands.

### Our approach:

We look at marketing from a holistic vantage point, where every piece of communication is a precise and personalized touchpoint that reflects on your brand's reputation.

We go to great lengths to make sure every single note we produce is unique, ensuring that even across a 1 million+ note campaign, no two messages would ever look alike.

In your recipient's eyes, someone from your brand took the time to write them this handwritten note in pen on beautiful stationery.

### How We Got Here

While Wami "officially" started in 2019, our story begins in 2016 at?Bond.co?where we had the chance to work together building products used to send millions of handwritten notes.

When Bond closed in 2019, we launched Wami to focus on providing high-quality, handwritten notes at scale and explore our firm belief that there are better ways for brands to connect with customers than sending out millions of emails.

### What Does Wami Mean?

Pronounced [Wah-me]

We're self-proclaimed tech nerds, and we've often pondered the first words a robot would say if/when they became self-aware of their existence.

"Who am I?"

"Where am I?"

"What am I?"

Hence the name Wami was born.

contact_address: 55 Washington Street, Brooklyn, NY, 11201, US
intro:
Wooster is an all-in-one platform for organizing and closing your revenue opportunities.

We started Wooster because we were frustrated with the current options to keep track of conversations with our customers, more effectively engage with potential new customers, and grow our revenue. We felt like every solution we saw made the process more complicated.

We wanted to talk more, type less, and feel like our software was assisting us rather than adding a tedious step to an already busy workday. The idea to create a new system from the ground-up was born when I woke up in the middle of the night in a panic. I forgot to follow up with someone and had a proposal to a prospective client still in my inbox. I was frustrated at myself for potentially missing this opportunity. I had missed a critical follow up and only had myself to blame. However, I started to think about how I must not be the only person with this problem.
